availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles S. Glass (Jefferson County, Kentucky, steamboat mate and day policeman)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, steamboat mate and policeman. Native of Ireland. Married to Elizabeth McLean Glass. Father of Mary C. Glass, Margaret Glass, Alexander Glass, Jane Glass, and Charles W. Glass. Steamboat mate in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Day policeman in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 10, p. 424B-425A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 769.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 373A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #1232.
Find A Grave, "Charles S. Glass (1809-1879)," Memorial #126262681, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126262681 (accessed May 27, 2021).
